==Government Tender Announcement for Laboratory Analytical Services==

### Overview
The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada invites qualified suppliers to respond to the Request for Standing Offer (RFSO) for Laboratory Analytical Services. The successful standing offer agreements will be for up to five suppliers who can provide laboratory analytical services to meet the needs detailed below.

### Scope of Work
The Regional Office of Environmental Coordination (ROEC) within Real Property Safety & Security (RPSS) of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans-Pacific Region requires suppliers who can conduct and manage site assessment, site characterization, and environmental audit projects on federal lands. These projects involve assessments of contaminants in air, soil, soil vapour, sediments, surface water, groundwater, drinking water, pore water, building materials, and plant and animal tissues.

### Mandatory Requirements
To be considered for this RFSO, suppliers must meet the mandatory evaluation criteria as detailed below:

1.  Hold the certification of the Standards Council of Canada - Canadian Association for Laboratory Accreditation (SCC - CALA) at the time of bid close.
2.  Provide two relevant laboratory analytical services projects completed within the last five years.
3.  Ensure that their proposed Senior Technical Specialist has a minimum of 120 months (10 years) work experience related to contaminated sites analyses within the last 120 months (10 years) and demonstrate this experience by providing relevant completed projects information.
4.  Ensure that their proposed Project Manager has a minimum of 96 months (8 years) of Project Management Experience related to contaminated sites analyses, within the last 120 months (10 years) and demonstrate this experience by providing relevant completed projects information.

### Trade Agreements
This RFSO is subject to various trade agreements, including the Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), and others.

### Period of Standing Offer
The services are to be performed on an “as and when required” basis during the period from the date of award to September 30, 2028, inclusively.

### Security
There is no security requirement for this contract. Suppliers working under this standing offer agreement must not be given access to sensitive information or assets, and must be escorted at all times while on DFO premises.

### Selection Method
The basis of selection is the Highest Compliant Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price.
